sentence.text: A stranger to the district , coming over a brow of the hill , would have stopped astonished and perhaps a little peeved to see Ploughman 's Lane lying beneath him .
Morrissey was obviously peeved at The Smiths continued existence as a relatively small ` cottage industry " .
` You could have lent it to me , " Paula said , peeved .
I dare say a few prize juries might be peeved at having their judgment queried , too .
He sifted , somewhat peeved , through the remaining unopened mail .
She thought she had given him a very tricky word , one that he would n't yet have learned , and she was peeved that he had succeeded .
His smile was patient , peeved , and very sad .
Of course Ed was really peeved about how Martinez handled the whole Harley business .
They 're also pretty peeved at what they see as the Ministry of Agriculture 's failure to represent their interests adequately in Brussels .
` Why ? " sighed Petrova , a little peeved that her deductions were now proving wide of the mark .
I was peeved to see Robert Kilroy-Silk credited with inventing the egg trick in a recent colour supp. profile .
` I think your friend Billy and his fellow commandos were a bit peeved to find themselves here after the horse had bolted , so to speak . "
In fact , now you come to mention it , I 'm a little bit peeved with her .
I 'm not surprised he 's feeling peeved .
` I still feel quite peeved about it ; well , more than that really . "
They played throughout the second half in peeved mood , allowing Blackburn to assume the dictating role with Gordon Cowans prompting from midfield and Speedie in predatory form up front .
